abstract: General Electric has repeatedly insisted that NBC Universal isn’t for sale. But engaging in a bit of speculative whimsy, Jack Flack helps the conglomerate game out just how it should go about trying to sell the network-and-movie-studio unit.
snippet: General Electric has repeatedly insisted that NBC Universal isn’t for sale. But engaging in a bit of speculative whimsy, Jack Flack helps the conglomerate game out just how it should go about trying to sell the network-and-movie-studio unit.
lead_paragraph: Despite his protests to the contrary, no one seems to believe General Electric‘s Jeffrey Immelt when he says he has no plans to sell NBC Universal. As Jack Flack notes, the conglomerate’s chief sounds a close-to-Shermanesque note in his 2007 letter to investors (PDF): “I just don’t see it happening … not before the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games … not after the Olympic Games. It doesn’t make sense.”
